text: 2025: The Year That Wasn‚Äôt Only 11% of organizations are using AI agents in production. The usual excuses‚Äîtraining gaps, governance barriers‚Äîmiss the real issue: agentic AI simulates goals rather than having them. This makes intent unstable in unanticipated contexts. Companies are building coordination infrastructure before proving the value justifies it‚Äîhistorically backwards. We're not waiting for better implementation. We're waiting for agents with squirrel-level persistence.

text: Why Weirdness May Be the Most Important Skill in the Age of AI Educators and futurists talk a lot about creativity, empathy, and adaptability as essential human skills in the age of AI ‚Äî but we‚Äôre leaving something out. In a world where generative AI thrives on averages, the most uniquely human trait may be weirdness: our ability to be original, unpredictable, and gloriously offbeat. This piece explores why weirdness belongs in every skills framework and how teachers can help students stay joyfully non-average ‚Äî and, therefore, irreplaceable.
